metadata.title: CVE-2020-25669 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in the Linux Kernel where the functionsunkbd_reinit having been scheduled by sunkbd_interrupt before sunkbd beingfreed. Though the dangling pointer is set to NULL in sunkbd_disconnect,there is still an alias in sunkbd_reinit causing Use After Free.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25669` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-136-generic - 4.15.0-136.140
linux-image-4.15.0-136-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-136.140
linux-image-4.15.0-136-lowlatency - 4.15.0-136.140
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-136-generic - 4.15.0-136.140
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-136-lowlatency - 4.15.0-136.140
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-66-generic - 5.4.0-66.74~18.04.2
linux-image-5.4.0-66-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-66.74~18.04.2

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-136.140').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-66.74~18.04.2').

linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1094.101').
